# What is electricity??

## Electricity is made of moving charged particles

</br> 

Every atom is made of particles 

:::{.incremental}
* Protons 
* Neutrons
* Electrons 
:::

![](Pictures/atom.png){.absolute top="300" right="70" height=400}


## Electricity is made of moving charged particles

::::columns

::: {.column width="50%"}

:::r-stack
:::{.fragment .fade-out fragment-index="1"}
* *high potential* -> *low potential*
* Moves energy that can perform work
:::

:::{.fragment .fade-down fragment-index="1"}
* *high potential* -> *low potential*, 
* Moves energy that can perform work
:::
:::

## Electrons go the opposite way? Confusing! 

Benjamin Franklin didn't know what electrons were: he guessed which way the charge was moving -- and he guessed wrong!

![](/HobbyEEProjects/Sunnyside_Electronics_Presentations/Pictures/wire-conventional-current.png){fig-align="center" .r-stretch}

(but luckily it doesn't change how the circuit works)

# Types of circuits

## 
:::::{.columns}

::::{.column width="50%"}

### Series

Only one path for the current to go.

![](Pictures/Series.png){.absolute top=210 left=-75 width="600"}


::::

::::{.column width="50%"}

### Parallel

Multiple ways to get back to the negative terminal.

![](Pictures/Parallel.png){.absolute top=150 right=-100 width="750"}

::::
